name: Learner Support: Badges Guide
title: Learner Support: Badges Guide
label_names: How to Create an Action in PhishER
body:
As you complete your training or report phishing emails, you can earn badges. Each badge is based on a specific achievement, such as completing multiple training assignments within 24 hours or reporting 100 simulated phishing emails. On the Badges tab of your Learner Experience (LX), you can view all the badges you’ve already earned as well as any available badges.

Important:You can only earn badges allowed by your organization. If your organization adds a new badge and you complete the achievement before the badge is added, you will not earn the badge.

To learn more about badges, see the table below:

Badge How to Earn the Badge

Cyber Hero

 Complete your first training assignment.

Night Owl

Work on a training assignment at night, between 8 PM and 2 AM.

Note:The LX uses the time zone set in your browser to determine when you work on a training assignment.

Early Bird

Work on a training assignment early in the morning, between 2 AM and 8 AM.

Note:The LX uses the time zone set in your browser to determine when you work on a training assignment.

Pioneer

Be one of the first 10 users to start a training assignment from a specific training campaign.

Important:You cannot earn this badge by completing optional training. 

Lightning Fast

Be the first user to complete a training assignment from a specific training campaign.

Important:You cannot earn this badge by completing optional training.

New Recruit

 Start your first training assignment.

Graduate

 Download your first training certificate.

Hat Trick

 Complete three training assignments within 24 hours.

Eager Beaver

 Complete five training modules from your library.

Eagle Eye

 Report at least 100 simulated phishing emails.

Linguist

Review your language options in the LX.

On the Go

Earn this badge by logging in to the KnowBe4 Learner App for the first time.

Total Recall

Earn this badge by completing a Knowledge Refresher.

Important:You can only earn this badge if you have purchased AIDA as an add-on to your Diamond-level subscription.

Hyperdrive Hero

Earn this badge by being the first to complete a Policy quiz and navigate policies at light speed.

Important:You can only earn this badge if you have purchased AIDA as an add-on to your Diamond-level subscription.

Policy Professional

Test your policy prowess by completing your first Policy quiz to unlock this badge.

Important:You can only earn this badge if you have purchased AIDA as an add-on to your Diamond-level subscription.

images.alt: This image is a technical icon rendered in orange line-art. It features a stylized face mask (covering the eyes and upper face) centered within a defined circular outline. A small plus symbol (**+**) is positioned outside the mask geometry, located in the upper right quadrant of the encompassing circle. This UI element typically denotes the action of creating, adding, or selecting a new mask, filter, or identity profile.

This UI icon is a monochromatic vector graphic rendered in orange line art. It features a central circular border enclosing the following elements:

1.  **Primary Subject:** A stylized outline of an owl (suggesting nocturnal activity) positioned centrally.
2.  **Contextual Elements:** Located in the upper-left quadrant are two ancillary symbols: a crescent moon and a small four-point star or plus sign.

**Context:** This graphic is utilized within the user interface to denote and activate the **Night Mode**, **Dark Theme**, or **Low Light settings** functionality.

**Image Description for Technical Manual:**

**Icon/Element ID:** Sun and Horizon Icon (Environmental/Time Context)

**Description:** A vectorized, monochrome UI icon rendered in a thin orange outline. The primary element is a large circular frame containing a stylized scene. Within the frame, a half-circle element representing the sun is centered above a horizontal line representing a horizon or waterline. The sun emits ten equidistant short, straight rays. The upper field features two small, angular shapes symbolizing birds in flight. The sun’s body contains a subtle, lighter orange fill.

**Context/Function:** Used in interfaces to symbolize weather conditions, vacation settings, outdoor activities, or time-of-day controls (e.g., sunrise/sunset timing).

This image is a monochromatic vector UI icon rendered in orange line art.

**Composition and Structure:**
The design depicts two overlapping flags mounted on a flagpole, framed by an incomplete circular boundary.

1.  **Primary Flag:** A rectangular banner positioned in the foreground, featuring a centrally aligned, outlined five-pointed star.
2.  **Secondary Flag:** A smaller, partially obscured flag shape layered behind the primary banner.
3.  **Frame:** The entire composition is enclosed within a thin, open-ended circular stroke.

**Contextual Function:**
The icon serves as a visual identifier typically used in UI environments to represent concepts such as Milestones, Reports, Objectives, Campaigns, or general content Flagging/Marking.

This image is a concise vector UI icon, rendered in monoline orange line-art, typically used to indicate severe weather or electrical phenomena.

**Description of Elements:**
1.  **Frame:** A continuous, complete circular outline.
2.  **Primary Graphic:** A stylized cloud shape occupying the upper center of the circle.
3.  **Detail:** A prominent, vertical lightning bolt centered within the cloud outline.
4.  **Supplementary Elements:** Two small plus-sign or asterisk symbols are positioned around the main graphic: one to the right side of the cloud, and one centered near the bottom edge of the circular frame.

**Context:** The graphic serves as a universal indicator (e.g., in a dashboard or application) for **Thunderstorm** conditions or **Electrical Storm Warning** status.

This is a stylized, single-color (orange/amber) outline icon designed to represent multimedia or highlighted video content.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Central Element:** A rectangular shape symbolizing a film strip or video frame, featuring dashed lines along the top and bottom edges (perforations).
2.  **Embedded UI:** A standard right-pointing triangle, serving as the universal 'Play' icon, is centered within the rectangle.
3.  **Frame:** The entire composition is contained within a hand-drawn, irregular circular outline.
4.  **Emphasis Indicator:** Three short, radiating line segments (flares or sparkles) extend from the upper right quadrant of the icon, typically used to denote new, highlighted, or active content.

**Icon Type:** Outline/Monochrome UI Icon.
**Primary Element:** A graduation cap (mortarboard) depicted in a stylized outline.
**Container/Boundary:** The cap is enclosed within an irregular, circular outline, suggesting a hand-drawn aesthetic.
**Color Scheme:** All elements (cap, circle, modifier) are rendered in a single, consistent orange hue.
**Modifier Element:** A small plus sign (+) is positioned in the upper right quadrant, slightly outside the cap but adjacent to the boundary.
**Context/Function:** This element typically represents an action related to adding educational credentials, certifications, or new learning opportunities (e.g., "Add Education" feature).

This is an orange vector icon designed to illustrate workflow completion or status verification.

The graphic is contained within a bold, circular orange outline. The central element is a vertical timeline or sequence featuring three circular nodes, interconnected by a solid vertical line. Each node contains a checkmark symbol (tick), signifying the successful completion of a step or task. The uppermost node is subtly highlighted (lighter orange fill).

**Context:** This icon functions as a UI element to denote successful progression, the culmination of a multi-step process, or an "All Tasks Completed/Verified" status.

The image is a monochromatic (orange outline) circular icon depicting a stylized mascot, identifiable as a rodent (likely a beaver) due to its prominent incisors. The figure is positioned within the circular frame and is holding a diagonally oriented, tied scroll or diploma.

**Contextual Function (UI Element):** This graphic functions as an avatar or system icon representing **Certification, Documentation, Achievement Status,** or **Educational Content.**

**Technical Details:**
*   **Format:** Vector-style line art.
*   **Color:** Single-color orange outline against a white background.
*   **Enclosure:** Circular frame.
*   **Text/Labeling:** None visible.

The image displays a vector-based, monochromatic icon rendered in an orange outline. The primary element is a stylized profile of a bird of prey (eagle or hawk) head, characterized by a sharp beak and defined eye/brow ridges, conveying an alert or aggressive posture. This figure is contained within a circular outline. A small, secondary geometric element, shaped like an 'X' or starburst, is positioned externally to the circle in the top-right quadrant, typically signifying a feature, premium status, or notification context within a UI environment.

This is a circular UI icon rendered in orange, symbolizing a disabled or unavailable language feature.

The icon contains two adjacent speech bubble glyphs. The left bubble displays a stylized non-Latin character (specifically the Chinese character $\text{文}$); the right bubble displays the uppercase Latin letter "A." A prominent diagonal line runs across the entire interior, crossing through both speech bubbles and the center of the circle, which functions as a standard strikethrough symbol indicating that the contextual feature (translation or language conversion) is inactive or blocked.

The graphic is an orange, outline-style icon framed within a circular border. It depicts a simplified outline of a mobile phone. A solid orange square UI element is superimposed onto the lower section of the phone, containing a centered white circular arrow icon (representing rotation or refresh). Short, radial lines emanate from the upper right of the square, indicating an active state or triggered action related to screen orientation or data synchronization.

A single-weight line-art interface icon, rendered in orange. The composition consists of a circular boundary enclosing a stylized graphic. The central graphic depicts a simplified human head/figure outline intersected by two intersecting elliptical orbits, suggesting an atomic model or cognitive processing. Four auxiliary spark/radiating line elements are distributed within the circle's periphery. This icon typically serves as a UI indicator for concepts such as Intelligence, Machine Learning (ML), Core Insights, or advanced processing features.

**Icon Type:** Performance/Launch Indicator.

**Design:** Monochromatic outline icon rendered in orange/amber line weight. The primary image is contained within a solid circular border.

**Subject:** A stylized rocket ship shown in ascent, oriented diagonally upward and to the right. The rocket features defined fins, a cockpit window (circular element), and multiple exhaust/thrust lines extending from the base.

**UI Elements:** Includes two minor four-point starburst accents positioned within the circular frame, suggesting speed or novelty.

**Context:** Used to denote Initialization, Rapid Deployment, Performance Optimization, or the "Launch" state of a feature or process (e.g., Quick Start functionality).

The image is a vector icon rendered in orange lines on a white background, representing validated, layered data or documentation integrity.

**Elements and Context:**

1.  **Primary Structure:** The central graphic is defined by a thick, open orange circular boundary.
2.  **Central Iconography:** Three stacked, overlapping sheets of paper or documents are depicted in the center, signifying layers or multiple files. The top sheet contains three horizontal lines, representing text or content data.
3.  **Status Indicator (UI Element):** A small, filled orange circle is positioned at the bottom center, flush with the main circular boundary. This circle contains a clear white checkmark (tick mark), indicating successful validation, confirmation, or completion.
4.  **Secondary Elements:** Two small, orange plus signs (+) are positioned within the main circle, one in the upper-right quadrant and one in the lower-left quadrant.

**Interpretation:** The icon generally represents the successful validation or confirmed integrity of multi-layered files or aggregated data sets.
